plugins.name: Ad Lib(s)
plugins.description:
Find out if your library components are used, in a list of design files.


1. How does it work? 


  1. First, go to your Figma settings and get a personal access token (aka a key which enables you, and only you, to communicate with your files),
  2. Then, copy / paste the links of both the library and the design files you want to inspect (those are the same links you use when your share a file, using the "Share" button)
  3. After a while, you should then see a list of all instances found in your design file, which components are used, and which aren't. You can click on a component, in order to locate it in your library file (to do so, you must launch this plugin in your library file)


2. Notes 


  • Please note that your personal token won't be shared or used in any way.
  • This plugin doesn't modify anything in your design (it only inspects, nothing more)
  • You need to be a least a member of a Team, otherwise you can't really use librairies, and this plugin won't be useful
  • All the files you can inspect must be created by you, or come from a Team you're a member of
  • The bigger the files, the longer you'll have to wait ! So, please be patient sometimes :)


If you find bugs, possible improvements, please feel free to contact me.

plugins.name: Alwan
plugins.description:
About Alwan

Alwan is your custom controlled random color generator.You can use Alwan to control what range of colors to apply randomly on selected elements. Effortlessly apply dynamic colors to selected elements with custom HSL Range values.


Features

Customize, Select, Apply!

  • Apply random colors to fills and strokes of selected elements.
  • Choose and control on what to apply from a variety of element types

- All : All elements selected (Including Group children)

- Rectangles : All rectangles selected

- Ellipses : All ellipses selected

- Polygons : All polygons selected

- Stars : All stars selected.

Text : All texts selected


  • Customize HSL ranges to control the color spectrum.
  • Instantly apply random colors with a single click.
  • Choose a HSL Preset to apply on selected elements.


Alwan streamlines the color design process, adding an element of spontaneity to your Figma workflow.


Instructions


Color Range

  • If you want to manually customize the color range than in the Custom Tab
  1. Customize Hue, Saturation & Lightness ranges using the sliders or manually input the values.
  2. Setup your Target Preferences.
  3. Click “Apply on x selected elements”.


  • If you want to use one of the Range Presets
  1. Choose which preset you want to apply Full Spectrum, Vibrant, Neon, Pastel, Light & Dark Colors.
  2. Setup your Target Preferences.
  3. Click “Apply on x selected elements”.


Target Preferences

  • Define where to apply colors : Fills / Strokes
  • Define the element type you want to be affected by the random colors.


Please note: If you did not set a certain range for the colors, the plugin will automatically apply the full range for Hue, Saturation & Lightness. 


Experiment with different settings to discover new color combinations.


You can reach me out for feedback and bug reports at hello@brahimr.com or via my personal contact form at https://brahimr.com/contact.


Thank you and happy randomizing!
plugins.tagline: Apply random colors to fills and strokes of selected elements within a custom HSL range.

Introducing Gemma


Gemma is the personal assistant you've been looking for to solve all your design needs. No more endless hours searching for the perfect images or struggling with copywriting. With a huge library of resources, Gemma is always just a conversation away. It's super easy to use and feels like you're having a conversation with a real person. Gemma is also an expert in copywriting. With a simple command, you can check your copy for errors and get suggestions for improvements. One of the coolest things about Gemma is that it learns from you. As you use the plugin, Gemma learns your preferences and adapts to your style. It's like having a personal assistant who knows exactly what you need and how you work. Trust us, try Gemma today and you'll get unlimited wishes and a new best friend to help you with all your design needs.

plugins.name: Solo - Portrait Background Remove
plugins.description:
Remove Backgrounds from Images for Free

Using the latest in machine learning models, this tool allows you to select any Figma node, then remove the background from the foreground instantly and freely.


Simply.

  1. Select the Figma objects with images that you'd like to remove the background from
  2. Right click and run "solo" from the plugins menu
  3. Wait and in a few seconds your image will be ready and replaced.


Solo runs all image processing on-device in Figma, so your images are fully secure and never leave your device.


Note

As this plugin uses cutting edge machine learning models, it may not be compatible with all devices and browsers and will likely have variable results on images. Apologies in advance if it doesn't work for you!


I've found this model works best on people rather than foreground objects.
plugins.tagline: Remove background from any image in Figma for free and securely, on-device.

plugins.name: Visual Color Picker The Palette Playground
plugins.description:
This visual color palette picker plugin is your one-stop shop for creating stunning color schemes!


The ultimate visual color palette creator! Craft harmonious color combinations with a user-friendly interface that provides a real-time visual preview. Explore a wide range of colors and find the perfect match for your project.


Visually select colors: Move beyond clunky code pickers. Use intuitive color wheels, spectrums, and even gradient pickers to find just the right shades.


Real-time preview: See how your chosen colors look in action! Instantly preview your selections on a design mock-up or within your application interface.


Craft perfect palettes: Don't just pick one color - build a whole harmonious scheme! Create custom palettes and save them for future projects, ensuring brand consistency.


Advanced features: Many plugins offer additional functionality, like creating smooth color transitions, managing color history, and working with different color formats (HEX, RGB, HSL).


With this plugin, take the guesswork out of color selection and create beautiful, cohesive designs with ease!


Intuitive UI Design:

Effortlessly create palettes with a clean and modern interface.


Instant Visualization:

See how your chosen colors work together as you build your palette.


Export for Any Project:

Save your creations in various formats, including SVG, Adobe ACO, JSON, CSV, and all major image formats.

plugins.name: Tokeno
plugins.description:
Overview:

Tokeno is a versatile Figma plugin designed to streamline the conversion of local variables into usable code snippets. With Tokeno, designers can effortlessly extract variable names and their corresponding values from Figma's local variables collection. The plugin then transforms this data into JSON format, offering seamless integration with development workflows. Moreover, Tokeno facilitates the conversion of JSON data into TypeScript (ts) and SCSS files, optimizing the transfer of design tokens into code.


Key Features:

  1. Local Variable Extraction: Tokeno simplifies the process of gathering variable names and values directly from Figma's local variables collection.
  2. JSON Conversion: The extracted data is automatically formatted into JSON, ensuring compatibility and ease of use across different platforms and environments.
  3. Code Generation: Tokeno empowers users to effortlessly convert JSON data into TypeScript (ts) and SCSS files, streamlining the transition of design tokens into development-ready code.


User Interface:

Tokeno boasts an intuitive user interface featuring two prominent buttons:

  1. Download TS: This button enables users to instantly download the generated TypeScript (ts) file containing the extracted local variables in a structured format.
  2. Download SCSS: With a single click, users can download the generated SCSS file, facilitating seamless integration of design tokens into SCSS-based projects.
plugins.tagline: Tokeno: Bridging Design and Code Seamlessly.

plugins.name: Mermaid to FigJam
plugins.description:
## ✨ New Features


### FigJam → Mermaid Conversion

- **Section-based conversion**: Select any FigJam Section and convert all flowchart elements within it to Mermaid code

- **Smart node mapping**: Automatically generates clean, sequential node IDs (A, B, C... AA, AB... for 26+ nodes)

- **Shape recognition**: Correctly identifies rectangles, diamonds, and circles from FigJam shapes

- **Connection preservation**: Maintains all connections with labels and arrow types

- **Large diagram support**: Handles flowcharts with 100+ nodes efficiently


### Enhanced UI/UX

- **Dynamic button states**: FigJam → Mermaid button is enabled only when a Section is selected

- **Improved UI layout**: Cleaner interface with Sample Flowchart and Clear links

- **Real-time feedback**: Clear status messages for successful conversions

- **Bilingual support**: Works seamlessly with both English and Japanese text


### Technical Improvements

- **Robust error handling**: Graceful handling of edge cases and missing connections

- **Performance optimizations**: Efficient processing of large diagrams

- **Debug logging**: Comprehensive logging for troubleshooting (in development mode)


## 🔄 Conversion Capabilities


### Mermaid → FigJam (Enhanced)

- Automatic Section creation with timestamp

- Optimized layout algorithm with branch/merge point detection

- Smart connector routing to minimize overlaps

- Support for all Mermaid node shapes and connection types


### FigJam → Mermaid (New)

- Clean Mermaid code generation

- Preserves flowchart structure and logic

- Handles complex branching and merging patterns

- Maintains connection labels and directionality


## 📋 Usage


1. **Mermaid → FigJam**: Paste your Mermaid code and click convert

2. **FigJam → Mermaid**: Select a Section containing your flowchart and click convert

3. **Sample Flowchart**: Click to insert a sample Mermaid diagram

4. **Clear**: Reset the text area for new input


## 🛠️ Technical Details


- **Node ID Generation**: Intelligent mapping system supporting unlimited nodes

- **Shape Mapping**: FigJam shapes are correctly interpreted as Mermaid syntax

- **Section Detection**: Automatic detection of selected Sections for conversion

- **Color Scheme**: Light blue nodes (#C2E5FF) with blue connectors (#3DADFF)


## 🐛 Bug Fixes


- Fixed node positioning issues within Sections

- Resolved connector overlap problems in complex diagrams

- Corrected shape detection for rounded rectangles

- Fixed text encoding issues for Japanese characters


## 🔧 Requirements


- FigJam (Figma) desktop or web application

- Sections must be used for FigJam → Mermaid conversion


## 🚀 Getting Started


1. Install the plugin in FigJam

2. Try the Sample Flowchart to see the conversion in action

3. Use your own Mermaid code or convert existing FigJam diagrams


---


**Note**: This plugin is designed to work with standard flowchart patterns. Complex FigJam designs with custom shapes or annotations may not convert perfectly to Mermaid syntax.
plugins.tagline: Seamlessly convert between Mermaid code and FigJam diagrams. Code to visual,    visual to code.

plugins.name: SpecMate - Design to User Stories
plugins.description:
SpecMate is your go-to Figma plugin for converting designs into detailed, structured user stories, making the handoff between design and development seamless. It automates the process of translating design frames into actionable tasks for your project management tools, saving you time and ensuring nothing gets missed. Here’s how SpecMate works:


✅ Select Frames: Start by selecting at least one Figma frame that represents a screen or component of your design. You can also select multiple frames to document multi-step user flows.


🚀 Click "Generate User Stories": Once you've selected the frames, click the "Generate User Stories" button. SpecMate will analyze the frames, recognizing the necessary user stories based on the flow and the design elements present.


📝 Auto-Generated User Stories: SpecMate will automatically generate a detailed breakdown for each user story. This includes:

  1. User Story Description: A clear, concise explanation of what the user will do.
  2. Steps: Detailed steps capturing the flow of interaction within the selected frames.
  3. Acceptance Criteria: Well-defined criteria for each story to ensure the development meets expectations.
  4. Test Cases: Suggested test cases to verify the functionality and smooth execution of the user flow.


📋 Copy & Share: After generating the user stories, simply copy the content with one click and paste it into your favorite project management tool (e.g., Jira, Trello, Asana). This allows for easy collaboration with your team, ensuring that every design detail is captured for developers to implement.


SpecMate helps you streamline your workflow by bridging the gap between design and development, making sure no critical detail is overlooked. Transform your Figma designs into structured, detailed user stories in just a few steps!
plugins.tagline: Your best AI mate in writing user stories

plugins.name: Relative changes
plugins.description:
Change multiple values of nodes that show "Mixed" in the GUI with custom calculations.


Select the nodes you want to change and apply the changes of your calculations.


  • It resolves the limitation of applying changes to nodes which have mixed property values.
  • It provides usable variables from the node's properties value. You can use the width of the node as a multiple in your changes.
  • It provides a way to apply changes to nodes in a group, without affecting those individual elements. You do not have to create a new group to modify the elements, since doing so would extract those nodes from their respective group(s).

🆕 support for aliased variables and styles

✅ enjoy infinite variable modes on any Figma plan (even Free)

✅ apply modes to individual layers and sublayers, with native-like experience

✅ reorder variable modes (drag & drop)

✅ manage collections structure (create, rename or remove combined collections, variables and modes)


🎬 Demo video: https://youtu.be/oBsNb-wuqso?si=sx9yBvkEWSxff9EZ&t=400

(by Raul Marin, it's in Spanish, but it has generated and translated subtitles)


This plugin emulates additional modes available to the user by virtually connecting collections with the same name and structure.

From a user experience standpoint it mimics the native experience as much as possible.


In addition to the basic functionality of virtually connecting the collections and setting an explicit mode to a layer or page, the plugin also offers basic collection structure management features - adding, renaming and deleting modes and variables. These collection management features will display under the explicit modes panel, when there is no layer selected - you work with the whole page (similarly, you can access Local variables in Figma, when no layer is selected).


How it works:


Whenever you need to overcome the limit of modes inside a collection, you open the plugin, choose your collection and add the mode there. The plugin will create another collection with the same name and structure, but inside the plugin it will be one collection with more modes. Add as many modes as you need.


Since there are now multiple collections mimicking one, it could be hard to manage the structure of them - whenever you need to add/remove/rename a variable, you would need to do this in all of the connected collections. Luckily, you can do this inside the plugin, where it acts like one collection seamlessly.


For the plugin to connect the collections together, they need to have the same name and the same structure (if there is no pair for a variable in another collection, it will be indicated by displaying the variable in lighter gray color).


To keep things simple, setting actual values of the variables would happen still in the native Figma Local variables environment, because this is not a redundant work.

To navigate better between collections with the same name, you can add a unique identifier in parenthesis right after the name of the collections. The identification may be for example listing all the modes in that particular collection, or whatever you like, e.g. “My collection(en, de, es, it)” and “My collection(fr, pl, hu, cz)” etc.


Known limitations:


  1. aliased variables can only point to a non-combined collection. If you'd use combined collection for this purpose, you'd lose the ability to set explicit modes to individual layers


  1. the same as aliased variables goes for variables that are bound to styles


  1. When using bound variables in layout grids and switching from one type to the other (for example from Grid to Columns), always unbind all the variables in the former grid type (Figma Plugin API bug)


  1. Explicit modes badges won’t display correctly in the layers panel, due to the nature of how the plugin works (connecting multiple collections into one). You need to orient yourself only by what the plugin is showing you. If this turns out as a serious UX issue, I’ll try to figure out an alternative way of displaying explicit modes in layers hierarchy.


  1. If more libraries with the same name will be added to the file, the collections from these libraries will be grouped as if from one library, because current Plugin API doesn’t include a library id, just a name.


  1. If there is a change made in any of the added libraries while you have your file opened, you need to close the file and open it again to get the library changes. This is an issue with Figma Plugin API, the updated version of the library simply isn’t available through the API unless the file is reloaded.


  1. There might be some performance issues, especially on older machines, when you have selected layers that contain a lot of sublayers. This is due to the Figma Plugin API, that doesn’t offer properly working event notifications, and thus the plugin needs to go through every layer and sublayer of the selection to check for bound variables on a periodic basis (in contrary to event-driven basis) which is expensive in terms of performance. The refresh period is set to 1 second, so there might be up to about 1 second delay in refreshing the informations in the plugin, when you change something in the document. If you experience performance issues, deselect all layers when just moving through the document, or run the plugin only when you need to use it and then close it immediately.


  1. Despite my efforts, there still might be some bugs found. If you find any, I would really appreciate if you report them to me. Thank you!


Roadmap:


  1. there will be an option to automatically transfer the data from multiple collections created by this plugin into single collection (in case a user decides to switch to a Figma pricing plan, that offers more modes, or in case Figma changes the pricing model), or vice versa - from single collection into multiple collections (in case user decides to switch to a plan with less modes)


  1. planning a workaround for currently missing support for bound variables in styles

accepted.name: Michal Kováčik
accepted.description: UI/UX, branding, building tools for designers

plugins.name: Contently ✨ | Smart Content & AI Copilot
plugins.description:
Say goodbye to boring lorem ipsum

and repetitive placeholder images! With tailored smart templates, drag & drop across components and optional AI-Superpowers, and AI design feedback, you get fast, professional results—no hassle. 🎨⚡


Choose your Optional AI Assistant

ChatGPT, Gemini, Groq


Reusable Custom Templates:

Save your favorite templates and apply them instantly for a consistent, polished look every time.

Drag-and-Drop Simplicity:

Move images effortlessly—even between components—without the usual Figma hassle. Just drag, drop, and stay in flow.

Smart Select for Instant Refinements:

Quickly select elements by shared properties like size, font, or color. Example: Instantly adjust all text layers using the same fill color or font size—no manual clicking needed.

Smart Overflow:

Paste your text, and Contently will intelligently extend the selection vertically or horizontally to build lists and grids in seconds.

Powerful Image Compression:

Bloated Figma files? Compress images in seconds to keep your projects smooth and efficient. Example: Shrink a 5MB image to just 500KB without sacrificing quality.



Key Features

  1. Text Editing: Simple and intuitive content editing.
  2. Content Shuffling: Quickly generate text variations.
  3. Sorting Options: Organize text by value, length, or order.
  4. Batch Updates: Edit multiple elements at once.
  5. Smart Selection: Select by name or parent content. Invert or refine large selections in seconds.
  6. Smart Overflow: Extend the selection vertically or horizontally based on your text to create lists and grids in seconds.
  7. Random Numbers: Add natural variation to your data.
  8. Image Tools: Compress images for better performance.
  9. AI-Powered Features: Context-aware content updates.


Get Contently and design smarter today!

plugins.name: Resizer
plugins.description:
This plugin empowers you to resize multiple layers by independently setting their width, height, and constraints. Choose between fixed values, relative adjustments to the selected layer or its parent, or select from an expanding list of presets for even more flexibility.


Features

  1. Fixed values: Set specific sizes (e.g., 200).
  2. Relative to self: Use arithmetic operations (e.g., +20, -100, 5x, 1/4) to resize layers relative to their current dimensions.
  3. Relative to parent: Resize using percentages relative to the parent container (e.g., 50%).
  4. Custom options: Tailor resizing to fit unique scenarios.
  5. Familiar presets: Quickly apply predefined size options without taking your hands off the keyboard.


Custom Options

  1. Preserve width/height: Modify only one dimension.
  2. Lock aspect ratio: Adjust size while maintaining proportions.
  3. Mirror height/width: Change the orientation or inherit the opposite parameter.
  4. Fill width/height: Instantly fill the parent container.
  5. Stretch top/right/bottom/left: Resize to touch the parent container's boundaries.
  6. Minimum/Maximum among selection: Automatically set size to the smallest or largest dimension in the selection.


Known Issues

  1. Resize behavior may be unpredictable. Let me know your expectations in the comments!
  2. Search might not return expected results if you skip characters.
  3. You cannot use 0px values due to a limitation of the Figma API.
  4. The "Learn more" action is not available, yet.
  5. Some FigJam layers do not support resizing, and since the notification system is currently minimal, these layers are ignored without clear communication through the UI.


Future plans

I’m working on these updates based on your feedback. Your support, through comments, likes, or sharing, helps make these possible!

  1. Variable support: Set dimension-scoped variables for even more flexibility.
  2. Custom presets: Define your own presets.
  3. Anchor control: Adjust resizing behavior by choosing between center, top, right, bottom, or left anchor points.
  4. Improved search: Enhance search to handle cases where characters are skipped.
  5. Improved notifications: Enhance the response clarity after resizing.

accepted.name: Andrei Iancu
accepted.description: Design, eat, code, dream...

plugins.tagline: Resize multiple layers instantly with fixed, relative, or custom options.

plugins.name: Variables Design Sheet
plugins.description:
Instantly transform your Figma variables into a comprehensive, easy-to-read design system sheet.


Key Features:

• Lightning-fast generation of variable sheets

• Organized layout with grouped variables

• Support for multiple color modes

• Display of alias relationships between variables

• Clear typography for easy readability

• Hex codes for color aliases for quick reference

• Draggable groups thanks to auto-layout structure

• Alphabetical sorting of variables using Figma API

• Visual representation of your entire design system in one view


This is the first version of Variables Design Sheet, and it's free to use!

If you're enjoying the plugin, please leave a like and share your comments. ❤️
plugins.tagline: Transform Figma Variables into clear, organized design sheets.

plugins.name: Variables to JSON
plugins.description:
Variables to JSON Plugin

Easily convert Figma variables into structured JSON code, fully compatible with Style Dictionary Configurator.


Features:

✅ Export all variable collections into a single JSON file.

✅ Supports all variable types: Color, Number, String, and Boolean.

✅ Generate correct values for "Font Family, Font Weight, Opacity, Boolean"

✅ Support Variables Modes or Themes

plugins.name: Chart Generator
plugins.description:
Description

Generate random line or column charts that trend up, down, or randomly.


How To


  1. Select a shape on the canvas that you want to replace with a chart.
  2. Open the plugin.
  3. Select your chart type, number of data points, and trend direction.
  4. Click "Generate."
  5. Done!
plugins.tagline: Generate random line or column charts that trend up, down, or randomly.

plugins.name: Guide Man
plugins.description:
Guide Man is a straightforward and easy-to-use guide manager. It allows you to copy, paste, and replace guides within frames with ease.


Features

  • Clear Guides: Easily remove all guides from a selected frame.
  • Copy & paste/replace guides: Effortlessly duplicate or move guides from one frame to another.
  • Quick Actions support: Access key functionalities rapidly through Figma's Quick Actions.
  • Guide Manager: Provides an intuitive UI for listing, directly modifing values, and easily adding/deleting guides.

accepted.name: Hiroki Kokubun
accepted.description: Developer / Designer

plugins.tagline: Providing a feature to copy, paste, and replace guides within frames

plugins.name: Simple Stripes
plugins.description:
Simple Stripes - Create striped patterns with ease

A simple way to create a striped pattern that is fast, customizable, and easy to visualize.


Features:

  1. 🎨 Fully Customizable: Add as many colors as you want, reorder them, adjust size and angle.
  2. 👀 Live preview: See changes in real-time as you tweak your design.
  3. ✍️ Editable output: Each stripe is created with a parent component, so you can make edits to the pattern even after the plugin is closed.


If you run into any issues or have suggestions, please contact me at kwandy.com/contact. I'd also really appreciate if you could leave a comment on what you think 🙂
plugins.tagline: Create striped patterns with customizable colors, thicknesses, and angles.
